intro: Escobariopsis mazatlanensis, commonly known as the Mazatlan dwarf moss, is a small, mat-forming liverwort that thrives in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Pottiaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth pattern. The plant has a compact structure with closely packed, leaf-like structures that are typically less than 1 millimeter in length. It is often found on rocky substrates or in crevices, where it can retain moisture effectively. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
